subject: Relationships
title: Trust and Misinformation
description: A quick, practical guide to Trust and Misinformation.

hook.text: A lie can travel halfway around the world before the truth puts on its shoes. Social media proved Mark Twain right.

buildup.text: MIT research found that false news spreads 6x faster than true news on social media. Lies are more shareable.

discovery.text: Misinformation exploits trust shortcuts: it comes from friends, looks professional, and confirms existing beliefs.

twist.text: Fact-checking doesn't work as well as expected. People trust their social circle more than any correction by experts.

climax.text: In an age of infinite information, trust isn't about finding truth. It's about choosing who to believe â€” and why.

punchline.text: False news spreads 6x faster than truth. Trust is the real casualty.

quiz.question: How much faster does false news spread than true news?
